title: SS.PT.319
prompt: Which of the following conclusions can be drawn from President Obama’s speech?
description:
The passage is an excerpt taken from President Barack Obama's statement of "National Security Strategy," May 2010.

For nearly a decade, our Nation has been at war with a far-reaching network of violence and hatred. Even as we end one war in Iraq, our military has been called upon to renew our focus on Afghanistan as part of a commitment to disrupt, dismantle, and defeat Al-Qaeda and its affiliates. This is part of a broad, multinational effort that is right and just, and we will be unwavering in our commitment to the security of our people, allies and partners. Moreover, as we face multiple threats—from nations, nonstate actors, and failed states—we will maintain the military superiority that has secured our country, and underpinned global security, for decades.
feedback: President Obama states that “we face multiple threats” - not only a threat from Al-Qaeda - and the U.S. must work together with other countries to successfully address these threats. Only through maintaining the U.S. military power can we accomplish this goal.
